word:
Yet God had spoken, and His word must be obeyed. Abraham was stricken in years, but this did not excuse him from duty.  He grasped the staff of faith and in dumb agony took by the hand his child, beautiful in the rosy 
                                                                           167
health of youth, and went out to obey the word of God. The grand old patriarch was human; his passions and attachments were like ours, and he loved his boy, who was the solace of his old age, and to whom the promise of the Lord had been given.
